title: copy emails from imap folder to local folder
creator: co-base
content:
Hello, I use IMAP accounts for my online emails. And like yearly I make a mass copy of emails from an online folder to a local folder. I used the function "copy to" in the context menu, alternatively moving the mouse together with ctrl for the copy option. In my current version (nearly new...) the copy process is completely in the background (no info on progress etc.). And also no info on failing. And it does fail, after copying a small portion of the selected emails.

I would be totally fine with a modal dialog process, that is thunderbird blocked until the process has finished. Is there an option? Or any other way to have a bit more control on the process status and success? Thank you
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0

title: Need to backup data for Thunderbird installed via Microsoft Store
creator: jim4001
content:
I have backed up the data regularly before, but in the new Windows 11 pc, I cannot find the data.

It used to be "C:\Users\Jim\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\itfho9h2.default" on the old Windows PC which went bonkers. Now should be "C:\Users\Jim\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\i3ls19ra.default-esr", but when looking in the "C:\Users\Jim\AppData\Roaming\" folder, Thunderbird folder is not there with the others. But that is where Thunderbird data is supposed to be according to Account Settings, Message Storage, Local Directory.

So, how do I find where the data is so that I can back it up?

Thanks.

title: Unable to Update Thunderbird on Ubuntu even though its been quit and uninstalled
creator: David.Milne
content:
When trying to update Thunderbird on Ubuntu 24.04 the installer says "Quit to Update". I have quit Thunderbird and unpinned from task bar, restarted and still the same. I then decided to uninstall and used 'sudo apt remove Thunderbird' which says it was removed, I then used 'sudo apt purge Thunderbird' which comes back with Package 'Thunderbird' is not installed, so not removed. So tried again, Guess what same result! Any Ideas please?

sudo apt purge thunderbird Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree... Done Reading state information... Done Package 'thunderbird' is not installed, so not removed 0 to upgrade, 0 to newly install, 0 to remove and 3 not to upgrade.

title: Open Message in Conversation > rebuild database > indexing messages
creator: yannigvandewouwer
content:
"Open message in conversation" is no longer listed when I right click on an e-mail.

So I started investigating. Rebuilding the Global Database was suggested as a solution. So I deleted the "global-messages-db.sqlite" file (66MB), and started TB again.

Now the database starts rebuilding. I follow the status in the Activity Manager. It's stuck at: "Indexing messages Determining which messages to index in Inbox/+ 2023/+ Pantoon/+ Algemeen - Yannig.eu"

So I backup this folder "Algemeen", delete it from TB, and restart TB. Now the Indexer is stuck at the next folder. I once again backup, delete and restart. Now the indexer is stuck at the next folder in the list, and so on.

Any advice on how to break this cycle and get TB do index succesfully?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0

title: One Thunderbird account across multiple Windows 10 users?
creator: stuartfsamuel
content:
Looking for a way to let two Windows 10 user accounts access the same Thunderbird account/files.


We have a desktop PC used by two people, 'C' and 'S'. They each have a Windows user account, but share an a general email address (don't ask...)

The Thunderbird installation has at least 32GB worth of mail, going back several years, which I'd prefer not to duplicate on the hard drive. Additionally, mail is only stored on the server for 2 weeks, before being deleted. The Thunderbird installation is accessed from user account 'C'. The computer will, for practical reasons, only be used by one person at a time, but they will both be logged in most of the time, and would likely both have Thunderbird running at the same time.


Is there a way to direct Thunderbird, opened from user account 'S', to the files used by 'C'?

Thanks!
metadata: ;solver_id:6708424;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0

title: First Line of New Drafts Keeps Switching to Variable Width Font
creator: modernretro
content:
Hello, can anyone help me prevent my Thunderbird client from switching to Variable Width font in the first line of any new draft? It has been incredibly irritating when composing mail. (Same issue has occurred when responding to emails.)

My HTML code signature only has two empty lines, coded as such prior to the “Thank you,” as seen in my sequential screenshots: <font size="4" face="Helvetica">
<font size="4" face="Helvetica">

… yet there is a third empty line that precedes both of them when I click “+ New Message” or reply to email. When I go to line 2 or 3, then return to 1, it switches to Variable Width, and the font is also much smaller.

The problem does not occur when arrowing between lines 2 and 3... only when returning to line 1. </font> </font>

title: Falha na autenticação de conta
creator: alvaro.oliveira
content:
Olá, estou com problema para autenticar minha conta no Thunderbird.

Pra inicio de conversa, a conta é autenticada por pop3 e smtp SSL/TLS nas portas padrões. Entretanto pra autenticar pelo thunderbird, ele só encontra a conta se eu jogar a segurança como STARTTLS Porém agora, se eu jogo pra starttls, ele me volta como "login ou senha errada", já por ssl/tls me manda como "não foi possível encontrar os dados da conta".

O servidor é um zimbra, é administrado também por mim. Em outros clients de e-mail funciona por ssl/tls e também por starttls, todas em suas respectivas portas default. Entretando na empresa, ja é comum a muitos anos a utilização do thunderbird, então eu queria ainda manter no client.

Algum caminho pra verificar essa questão?
metadata: ;solver_id:6708675;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/136.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/136.0.0.0

title: On Ubuntu, Thunderbird ignores Environment Variable $BROWSER
creator: dwilde11
content:
I had set my Ubuntu 22.04 browser to Chromium for a while, but decided that all my cookies are in Firefox so I chose to switch back. Full reset after power-off, of course.

My Environment Variable $BROWSER is now set to Firefox, but Thunderbird apparently has a mind of its own. ;-) It still opens or switches to Chromium with every web link executed.

I've explored the ~/.thunderbird/ directory but see nothing there.

What am I missing that I need to be educated about?

Thanks in advance! 

 -- Don Wilde
